io.github.daveho.funwithsound

Class ConvertToCode

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.daveho.funwithsound.ConvertToCode

  • public class ConvertToCode
extends java.lang.Object
    Convert Rhythm, Strike, Melody, and Chord objects to code comprised of calls to Composer methods. These methods are used to convert live-played audition parts back into code, but they could also be very useful for turning algorithmically-created rhythms and melodies back into code.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConvertToCode() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String toCode(Chord c, Scale scale)
      Convert a Chord to code in the form of a single integer (if the chord's single note is part of the scale), a call to the Composer class's Composer.n(int...) method (if all of the chord's multiple notes belong to the scale), or the Composer class's Composer.an(int...) method (if any of the chord's notes do not belong to the scale.)
      static java.lang.String toCode(Melody melody, Scale scale)
      Convert a Melody to code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.m(Object...) method.
      static java.lang.String toCode(Melody melody, Scale scale, boolean useNL)
      Convert a Melody to code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.m(Object...) method.
      static java.lang.String toCode(Rhythm rhythm, Tempo tempo)
      Convert a Rhythm to code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.r(Strike...) method.
      static java.lang.String toCode(Rhythm rhythm, Tempo tempo, boolean useNL)
      Convert a Rhythm to code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.r(Strike...) method.
      static java.lang.String toCode(Strike strike, Tempo tempo)
      Convert a Strike into code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.s(double, double, int) method.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • toCode

        public static java.lang.String toCode(Rhythm rhythm,
                                      Tempo tempo)
        Convert a Rhythm to code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.r(Strike...) method. Newlines will be used in the returned code representation.
        Parameters:
        rhythm - the Rhythm
        tempo - the Tempo
        Returns:
        the code for the Rhythm

      • toCode

        public static java.lang.String toCode(Rhythm rhythm,
                                      Tempo tempo,
                                      boolean useNL)
        Convert a Rhythm to code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.r(Strike...) method.
        Parameters:
        rhythm - the Rhythm
        tempo - the Tempo
        useNL - true if newlines should be used in the returned code representation
        Returns:
        the code for the Rhythm

      • toCode

        public static java.lang.String toCode(Strike strike,
                                      Tempo tempo)
        Convert a Strike into code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.s(double, double, int) method.
        Parameters:
        strike - the Strike
        tempo - the Tempo
        Returns:
        the code for the Strike

      • toCode

        public static java.lang.String toCode(Melody melody,
                                      Scale scale)
        Convert a Melody to code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.m(Object...) method. Newlines will be used in the returned code representation.
        Parameters:
        melody - the Melody
        scale - the Scale: if non-null, pitches that belong to the scale will be generated as scale-relative notes rather than absolute MIDI note numbers
        Returns:
        the code for the Melody

      • toCode

        public static java.lang.String toCode(Melody melody,
                                      Scale scale,
                                      boolean useNL)
        Convert a Melody to code in the form of a call to the Composer class's Composer.m(Object...) method.
        Parameters:
        melody - the Melody
        scale - the Scale: if non-null, pitches that belong to the scale will be generated as scale-relative notes rather than absolute MIDI note numbers
        useNL - true if newlines should be used in the returned code representation, false otherwise
        Returns:
        the code for the Melody

      • toCode

        public static java.lang.String toCode(Chord c,
                                      Scale scale)
        Convert a Chord to code in the form of a single integer (if the chord's single note is part of the scale), a call to the Composer class's Composer.n(int...) method (if all of the chord's multiple notes belong to the scale), or the Composer class's Composer.an(int...) method (if any of the chord's notes do not belong to the scale.)
        Parameters:
        c - a Chord
        scale - the Scale (can be null if there is no scale)
        Returns:
        the code for the Chord
